titleStmt.title: Samuel Stone to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6128

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Warren County Ky
Feby 7. 1865
His Excellency Tho. E Blramlett.
Governor of Ky

The undersigned Samuel Stone a Citizen of said County, begs leave to represent that at the present term of the Warren Circuit court he has been fined fifty dollars for an alledged trespass. He states that the finding of the Jury is unjust -- that he is very poor with a family to support and cannot pay the fine without great prejudice to his family -- He therefore prays said fine be remitted.
The undersigned neighbors of said stone unite in the foregoing petition of Said Saml Stone

James Garrison
John. P. Collier
A. W. Marr
R. J. Hays
L. S. Beck.
O. H. Marr
Danel Cambell
Albena Sanders
Wilburn Mitchell
A. A. Collier
J. M. Puckett
Wm. Williams

Warren Cir Ct
vs
Saml Stone
